added.reason: Cycle 6 is the first cycle with serious counter-evidence. Counter-signals must be weighted heavily to prevent confirmation bias. A signal with strong counter-evidence should have its score reduced proportionally.
Counter-signal research revealed that multiple opportunities had well-funded competitors we hadn't scanned. Competitive density must become a first-class grading dimension.

graded_signals.headline: Chapter 11 filings +76% YoY (956 vs 544, Jan 2026)
graded_signals.notes: Continuing trend from Cycle 3. Strongest macro-level confirmation of P2 liquidation cascade. Not adjusted by counter-signals because the macro pattern is sector-agnostic — the cascade is real, the question is WHERE to enter it.

graded_signals.headline: Inference costs down 1000x — 320% AI spending surge confirms deployment phase
graded_signals.source: Stanford HAI Index / VC funding data
graded_signals.notes: Infrastructure overhang confirmed and accelerating. The 320% spending surge confirms Kondratieff deployment phase (T5). Cost floor keeps dropping — opens new business tiers monthly.

graded_signals.headline: Professional services employment -97K YoY (continuing decline)
graded_signals.notes: Signal confirmed but COUNTER-SIGNAL reduces actionability: BLS projects prof services as FASTEST-GROWING sector (10.5% 2023-2033). Current decline may be cyclical, not structural. Additionally, 147 PE deals and $500M+ from Crete means the 'opportunity' portion of this signal is crowded. The CASCADE is real but the ENTRY WINDOW may be closed for undercapitalized entrants.

graded_signals.headline: P7 Timing Arbitrage confirmed: HBR documents companies cutting on AI potential, not performance
graded_signals.source: Harvard Business Review / employer survey data
graded_signals.notes: P7 now promoted from 'emerging' to 'confirmed' pattern. Companies cutting humans before AI can replace creates service vacuums. HIGH PRIORITY for Cycle 7: identify specific sectors where these vacuums exist and are NOT being filled by well-capitalized players.

graded_signals.headline: JOLTS openings -966K YoY (-12.9%) — labor market cooling broadly
graded_signals.notes: Broad labor market cooling confirms the P2+P5 divergence corridor. Openings dropping fastest in sectors exposed to AI substitution. Reinforces the overall macro thesis even as individual opportunities get killed.

graded_signals.headline: PE accounting roll-ups: 147 deals, $200B new value — competitive landscape saturated
graded_signals.notes: NEW SIGNAL TYPE: competitive density as signal rather than noise. The fact that 147 PE deals exist in accounting is itself a signal about market timing. These PE roll-ups may become the NEXT Minsky moment (H2-H3). Track for future opportunities.

graded_signals.headline: Healthcare employment +709K YoY — demographic gap permanent and widening
graded_signals.kill_index_match: K-001 (partial — the demographic signal is valid but nurse-ratio-manipulation solutions are killed)
graded_signals.notes: SPLIT SIGNAL: The demographic gap is CONFIRMED and strengthening. But K-001 kills the specific nurse ratio manipulation thesis. Remaining viable angles: compliance-helping solutions, scheduling optimization, credentialing, travel nurse matching. These adjacent opportunities should be scanned in Cycle 7 if healthcare is revisited.

graded_signals.headline: Crete Professionals Alliance: $500M+, 900 employees, 17 offices — thesis competitor at 1000x capital
graded_signals.source: Crunchbase / company filings / Thrive Capital portfolio
graded_signals.notes: Critical competitive intelligence. Crete validates our thesis (distressed prof services + AI rebuild) while simultaneously blocking our entry. The existence of Crete is PROOF the thesis works — and proof we need a different angle. Most valuable counter-signal in the cycle.

graded_signals.headline: Immigration crackdown: 92% of contractors can't hire — construction labor gap structural
graded_signals.notes: Construction AI Coordinator opportunity (score 65 in Cycle 3) gains relevance as immigration enforcement tightens. No counter-signals received yet for this sector. PRIORITY for Cycle 7 competitive scan — need to check if well-funded players exist in construction AI coordination.

graded_signals.headline: Wages $37.02/hr (+3.75% YoY) — labor cost pressure continues across sectors
graded_signals.notes: Steady wage growth reinforces P3 cost kill thesis. Every percentage point of wage growth makes agentic substitution more compelling. Sector-agnostic signal.

graded_signals.headline: Bench.co catastrophic failure ($113M) — SMB back-office proven non-viable at scale
graded_signals.notes: This is a kill-confirming signal, not a new opportunity. Filed as evidence for K-002. The V9 Dead Business Check framework proved its value here — Bench is the 'dead business' we should learn from, not try to revive.

graded_signals.headline: Accrual (General Catalyst, $75M) launched Feb 2026 — 85% tax prep time reduction
graded_signals.source: Crunchbase / company announcement / General Catalyst portfolio
graded_signals.notes: Validates P1+P3 (infrastructure overhang + cost kill) in accounting specifically. Accrual launching same month as our analysis is a timing indicator — the window in accounting is NOW but requires $75M+ to play.

graded_signals.headline: Federal nurse ratio bills H.R. 3415 / S. 1709 — technology explicitly excluded from ratio calculations
graded_signals.notes: Primary kill evidence for K-001. Legislative text is unambiguous. Regulatory trajectory is tightening, not loosening. This is the most decisive counter-signal in the cycle.

graded_signals.headline: 20-25% client attrition on professional services firm acquisition (AICPA data)
graded_signals.source: AICPA Practice Transition Center / industry surveys
graded_signals.notes: Important unit economics input. Even PE firms with resources for smooth transitions lose 20-25% of clients. This attrition rate should be a standard assumption in any acquisition-based thesis.

graded_signals.headline: Olive AI ($1B raised) shut down — healthcare AI integration proven prohibitively expensive
graded_signals.source: Post-mortem analysis / SEC filings / healthcare industry press
graded_signals.notes: Supporting kill evidence for K-001. The $1B failure precedent is the single most important data point for calibrating capital requirements in healthcare AI. Any healthcare AI opportunity must explain why it will succeed where $1B failed.

transmission_chains.name: Professional Services Liquidation Cascade

N1_macro_shift.evidence: AI inference cost collapse (1000x), agentic capabilities crossing professional-grade threshold

N2_policy_response.evidence: No protective policy — unlike healthcare, professional services have no ratio laws or practice act protections that prevent AI substitution

N3_industry_structure.evidence: 147 PE deals restructuring sector, $200B new value, fragmented market being consolidated

N4_firm_behavior.evidence: Firms either acquiring AI capability (Crete $500M, Accrual $75M) or failing (Ch.11 +76%)

N5_labor_effect.evidence: Professional services -97K YoY, BLS data. Firms cutting ahead of AI capability (P7 timing arbitrage)

N6_micro_opportunity.evidence: Entry window exists but is dominated by players with $75M-$500M+ capital. Undercapitalized entry not viable in core US market.
N6_micro_opportunity.assessment: Chain fully materialized at N5-N6 but opportunity is CROWDED. Look for adjacent markets (LATAM, niche sub-sectors) or wait for PE Minsky moment.

transmission_chains.chain_velocity: Fast — advanced from N3 to N6 in 3 cycles
transmission_chains.opportunity_status: PARKED — chain confirmed but entry window crowded

transmission_chains.name: Healthcare Demographic Gap

N1_macro_shift.evidence: Aging population, nursing school capacity limits, immigration restrictions reducing healthcare labor supply

N2_policy_response.evidence: H.R. 3415 / S. 1709 BLOCK technology substitution. CA SB 596 increases ratio penalties. NNU anti-AI campaign.

N3_industry_structure.evidence: Hospitals competing for limited nurses, travel nursing inflated, Epic building AI from 42% market share

N4_firm_behavior.evidence: Hospitals spending more on staffing, not restructuring around AI. Olive AI $1B failure as precedent.

N5_labor_effect.evidence: +709K jobs but shortages persist. AI cannot legally substitute for nurse headcount.
N5_labor_effect.assessment: Chain STALLED at N5 by regulation. Federal law explicitly blocks the N5→N6 transition for technology-as-substitute solutions.

N6_micro_opportunity.evidence: Our proposed solution (ratio manipulation) is illegal. Adjacent compliance-helping solutions may exist but require fresh scanning.

transmission_chains.chain_velocity: Stalled — N2 policy response actively blocks chain progression
transmission_chains.opportunity_status: KILLED — chain stalled by regulation at N5

transmission_chains.name: P7 Timing Arbitrage — Premature Human Cuts

N1_macro_shift.evidence: AI hype cycle causing firms to cut human labor before AI can replace it. 55K AI-cited layoffs.

N2_policy_response.evidence: No policy intervention on AI-driven layoffs. Companies free to cut.

N3_industry_structure.evidence: HBR documents pattern across multiple sectors. Not yet concentrated in specific industries.

N4_firm_behavior.evidence: Companies cutting on AI potential not performance. Creates service vacuums in sectors where AI can't yet deliver.

N5_labor_effect.evidence: Need sector-specific data on which industries have the largest gap between human cuts and AI readiness.

N6_micro_opportunity.evidence: Opportunity to fill service vacuums created by premature cuts. Need to identify specific sectors.

transmission_chains.chain_velocity: Moderate — advancing but needs sector-specific data at N4-N5
transmission_chains.opportunity_status: HIGH PRIORITY for Cycle 7 — P7 confirmed but needs sector-level scanning to identify actionable opportunities

transmission_chains.name: Construction Labor Gap

N1_macro_shift.evidence: Immigration enforcement removing 25%+ of construction workforce. 92% of contractors can't hire.

N2_policy_response.evidence: Immigration crackdown is the policy response. No counter-policy to address construction labor shortage.

N3_industry_structure.evidence: Construction sector fragmented. No dominant AI coordination player identified yet. Need competitive scan.

N4_firm_behavior.evidence: Need data on how construction firms are adapting — which are adopting technology vs. which are simply shrinking?

N5_labor_effect.evidence: Need specific data on project delays, cost increases, and capacity reductions.

N6_micro_opportunity.evidence: Construction AI Coordinator thesis from Cycle 3 (score 65) needs counter-signal verification.

transmission_chains.chain_velocity: Slow — stalled at N3 pending competitive scan
intersections: TC-003 (P7 Timing Arbitrage — if construction firms cut management staff while keeping field workers)
transmission_chains.opportunity_status: SCANNING — needs Cycle 7 competitive scan and counter-signal research

data_specificity_boost_1.3.effectiveness: HIGH — correctly prioritized signals with hard numbers ($500M+, 147 deals, 80-99% false alarm rates) over vague narratives

novelty_reduction_0.7.effectiveness: HIGH — prevented 'shiny object' bias. Known-trend signals with deep data (Ch.11 +76%, wages +3.75%) correctly ranked above novel-but-thin signals

cross_signal_reinforcement_1.2.effectiveness: HIGH — correctly elevated signals with multiple confirming data points (prof services decline confirmed by BLS + Ch.11 + JOLTS + wage data)

new_weight_counter_signal_severity_1.5.effectiveness: CRITICAL ADDITION — without this weight, the three top opportunities would have maintained inflated scores. Counter-signals proved decisive in 3/3 verifications
new_weight_counter_signal_severity_1.5.recommendation: MAINTAIN at 1.5 for Cycle 7. This is now a permanent grading dimension.

new_weight_competitive_density_1.3.effectiveness: CRITICAL ADDITION — competitive density was the blind spot that inflated Opp 1 and Opp 3 scores. With this weight active, signals in sectors with >$100M deployed capital will be appropriately discounted

cycle_grading_summary.key_insight: Cycle 6 marks a maturity inflection for the engine. Previous cycles scored signals purely on opportunity strength. This cycle introduces counter-signal severity and competitive density as first-class dimensions. The effect: our highest-scored opportunity (87) was revised to 44. This is not a failure of the engine — it is the engine working correctly. The Principles Engine identifies WHERE disruption happens; the counter-signal framework identifies whether WE can be the disruptors.
